<DOMAIN>CONSTRUCTION</DOMAIN>
<RESUME_START>
CONSTRUCTION AND DESIGN PROJECT MANAGER

SUMMARY

Seasoned Design and Construction Project Manager with more than 13 years' experience in managing multimillion
projects in the US and abroad. Expertise in coordinating and overseeing all aspects of design and construction, from
conceptualization to completion, while providing continuous status reports to business owners and investors. Proven
track record of achieving construction goals and consistently completing projects on time and budget. Fluency in
English and Italian with working knowledge of Spanish and French. Seeking to leverage success and experience to take
next career step in a challenging project management position with a respected institution in Connecticut.

SKILLS

Sage Timberline Software, Compeat, QuickBooks, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access)

EXPERIENCE

Construction and Design Project Manager

10/2002 to Current
Company Name
City ,
State
Oversee all facets of project management for several multimillion-dollar restaurant and residential projects in
New York City and London, including contract negotiations and administration, project estimation, material
purchasing, budget management, and site management; managed design and construction for 10 projects to
date. Coordinate with owner and investors during pre-construction phase to develop requirements, scopes of work, and
budgets; execute and manage budget and schedules from conception to completion. Organize trades, procure source materials, and liaise between owner, principal architect, designers, engineers,
subcontractors, and vendors.
Partner with architects to solicit bids for construction and design, assess bids, and award contracts.
Manage selection and hiring of design and construction subcontractors, and work with both teams to achieve
milestones on time and on budget. Document observations and photograph ongoing design and construction work, produce field reports, and
regularly communicate project status to internal partners weekly. Investigate issues and expedite resolution to maintain timelines and budgets; develop strategies to prevent
recurrence of issues. Research and commission artisans to build site specific and custom objects for interior and exterior design and
décor. Source and purchase materials from international vendors, and purchase and coordinate material shipments from
vendors to construction sites. Ensure compliance with requisite regulations, including federal, state, and local building codes and safety
guidelines.
Past experience includes Education Program Coordinator at Solomon R.
Guggenheim Museum, Office
Manager at Cranmer Art Conservation, Inc., and Assistant Program Manager at Trinity College.

EDUCATION AND TRAINING

Bachelor of Arts :
Museum Studies and Art History Art History Italian
The City College of New York
City ,
State
Museum Studies and Art History Art History Italian
The University of Vermont
City ,
State
Dean's List

CERTIFICATIONS

Design and Construction
Budget Development and Management
Project Management
Requests for Proposal and Estimation
Contract Negotiations and Administration
Sourcing and Procurement

SKILLS

architect, Art, budget management, Budget Development and Management, budgets, budget, building codes, Contract Negotiations, contracts, Design and Construction, hiring, materials, Access, Excel, Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Office
Manager, Procurement, Project Management, Proposal, purchasing, QuickBooks, Research, safety, Sage, Solomon, Timberline

<JD_START>
Job Title: Project Engineer

Location: Houston, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
As the Project Engineer for Sustaining Capex Projects, you will manage and execute projects through all phases from project budget and development, through construction, commissioning, and completion, within budget, schedule, regulatory requirements, and industry accepted practices, as well as leading others as appropriate.
 Your Core Responsibilities:· Onsite project engineer supporting with onsite construction management.· Provide a project engineering service between consultant, contractor and internal stakeholders throughout all projects within your scope.· Review and make professional judgement on designs based on company Standards.· Ensure project is carried out in accordance with the Project Management (VPM) requirements, regulatory and statutory requirements.· Demonstrating excellent stakeholder management skills· Perform project development including project scope, cost estimate and schedule.· Familiar with project FEL process for project identification and option selection.· Onsite construction management through all phases, coordinate with Operations to develop operations, maintenance, and start-up procedures.· Develop material/construction bid packages for soliciting material/contractor bids, and eventual project execution (including drawings, specifications, work scopes and schedules).· Lead external multi-disciplinary teams and serve as a technical leader.· Apply economic evaluations such as cost savings, profit improvements and operational improvements to optimize project output.· Provide technical guidance to operating personnel.· Lead project incident investigations.· Communicate project progress and results in a concise and understandable manner.· Support the Department’s safety, health, and environmental policies.· Be a pro-active leader in safety matters· Act as the Initiator and/or Reviewer for any documentation or equipment changes within your scope by using the established Management of Change process.· Prepare reports for presentation to internal customers including, but not limited to, senior management.· Responsible for submitting purchase requests and receiving goods and services in the procurement system and complete necessary paperwork to ensure timely processing of invoices for payment.· Perform other duties as assigned by management that fall within the generally expected scope of this position.
Qualifications:· Required minimum 5 years relevant job experience.· Required bachelor’s Degree in Civil, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering or similar field of study.· Working knowledge of PHMSA Part 195, ASME B31.3/4, API 650/653, and NFPA along with the requirements and design criteria contained in these documents.· Must possess strong communications, analytical, and organizational and skills for· working with all levels within the organization.· Proficient computer skills, including word processing, spreadsheet calculations, project scheduling and presentation development within Microsoft Office applications.· Preferred prior experience in chemical storage terminals in the following areas: o Mechanical – Piping, Valves, Metering, Hydraulics, Pumps/Seal Systemso Civil – Foundations, Tanks, Supports, Marine Structureso Electrical – Automation, Controls, Instrumentation, Motors, Power· Ability and willingness to travel as required (est. 25%) and be self-motivated.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
